_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:29:16 using v2.0
title: How have NHS staff sickness rates changed?
analysis_commentary:
Sickness absence is subject to marked seasonal variation, with peaks in the late autumn/winter months and subsequent reductions. Absence rates reached a maximum of 4.96% in December 2010, with a minimum of 3.69% reported in May 2011.

The national rate has decreased over the time period measured; in 2009/2010 the national rate was 4.40%, in 2012/2013 it was 4.24% and in 2013/2014 so far the monthly average has not exceeded 4%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Sickness Absence Rates (Copyright Â© 2014, Health and Social Care Information Centre. All rights reserved)
